name: places/ChIJgxtFxk9YwokR0_vTOpdcJjs
formattedAddress: 605 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 605 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036-1124, USA

editorialSummary.text: Nightclub & concert venue in a former horse stable with industrial decor, VIP areas & a balcony.

originalText.text: Ok, if I was to just based my review on the venue it gets 4 stars. The place is nice. The atmosphere was great, the DJ and hosts were popping and kept the tunes coming. They played old school music, dancehall music, afro music, hip hop music. Now my real issue what's the food. I should really give it a one-star. Everything looks great on the plate but the flavor was not there. For the price that we paid I'm very disappointed. I had the shrimp and grits and there was barely grits and hardly any flavor. One of my friends had the French toast and that was not good at all. Next the package was supposed to be unlimited Mimosa with an appetizer and the appetizer that I was mentioned was not the appetizer that was sent out. Overall I was just not satisfied with the food service. If you want a place to go for a vibe I would totally recommend the spot but if you're looking for a place for good food, not my first choice at all. Unless you get the chicken and waffles, that was the only thing that I actually tastes good and the fries.

originalText.text: HK Hall was where Air-Otic took place. Beautifully spacious, large venue, well lit and good security presence. Audio and light engineer was definitely on point this evening. The performance was captivating, shocking, Beautiful and so engaging all at once... they were so incredibly talented, it was a beautiful time. Be prepared to pay for mandatory coat check and bathroom attendee fees on top of everything else. When they say doors open at 7, they mean it... so dress warm. Drink tickets for the VIP packages only apply to house liquor so choose wisely or you will pay extra for the top shelf, more common labels... food was amazing üëè  and the performance was very sexy, artistic, provocative yet conservative and so wildly fun. Great for a ladies night out.. a birthday dinner... date night... loved it ‚ù§

originalText.text: Concert venue, we went there to see an Argentinian band, it wasn‚Äôt as crowded as the last time I was there. Drinks are expensive but that‚Äôs common on these type of venues. No food for sale, bathrooms on the second floor, one handicapped restroom on the first floor. Overall good, small venue !

originalText.text: I had my Birthday Brunch here for the Big Apple Brunch. The Security at the door was nothing but nice while I waited for the rest of my party to come in the waiting area. The thing that didn‚Äôt make sense was we had to walk up the stairs just to go back down the stairs to get to Brunch meanwhile the entire time I can just go straight through the doors and I‚Äôll be right at the Brunch. My party ended up getting the Pre-fix menu brunch. The Brunch comes with Two chicken wings (LITERALLY) which was so good. We had 90 minutes of non stop mimosas and our entree. I ended up getting Rasta pasta. Have you ever had Rasta pasta with tomato sauce? When I seen that I said ohhh nooo. This is one of the reasons why I‚Äôm giving it a 4 star. The Rasta Pasta was nasty  ü§Æ it came with limited noodles and mini shrimps. It had a lot of bell peppers that were over powering the meals. I give that Rasta Pasta a 0/10 they need to look up how to make Rasta Pasta. Other than that the Big Apple Brunch was a vibe we came around 5 that‚Äôs when the party starts to get hype. There is this photographer that comes around and takes pictures she‚Äôs amazing, we did a little photo shoot and she was so nice. The waiter Paul is nice he was very attentive and busy at the same time. They also have hookah here. I brought cupcakes here and they charged me $25 to bring it.  I would come back here again just for vibes and good laughs.

originalText.text: The venue is nice. Friend and I went to see the Airotic soiree which was a great show (could've been longer as it was 1 hr instead of the advertised 2 hrs). The extremely small tapas/desserts were great since they were created from a celebrity chef but for the price and size-just not worth it. Neither were the overpriced drinks.
